transportAdvice: Oranjestad's compact downtown is walkable, but reaching beaches and resorts along the hotel strip is easier by bus, which runs frequently along the main tourist corridor. Taxis are widely available and commonly used for airport transfers and longer trips, though they operate on fixed rates rather than meters.

weather.description: Warm and dry with a refreshing trade wind breeze, making it one of the most pleasant months to visit.
Consistently sunny and dry with low humidity, ideal beach weather and one of the busiest tourist months.
Sunny and warm with very little rain, excellent conditions for outdoor activities and water sports.
Hot and dry with plenty of sunshine, great for snorkeling and beach days.
Temperatures begin to climb but remain dry, with calm seas and good visibility for diving.
Hot and mostly sunny with occasional brief showers, still well outside the main hurricane belt.
Warm and breezy with low rain risk, a quieter period that offers good value for travelers.
One of the hottest months but trade winds keep conditions comfortable and rain remains rare.
Hot with slightly higher humidity, though Aruba's position outside the hurricane zone keeps weather stable.
Marginally wetter than earlier months but still largely sunny, with short passing showers possible.
Rainfall increases slightly compared to the dry season but conditions remain generally pleasant for travel.
Dry and comfortable conditions return as the holiday season begins, with warm temperatures and reliable sunshine.
